path: 2025/Spring/PSY-101 - Intro to Psychology/PSY-101 - Module 2/Attachments/Screenshot 2025-01-30 at 2.20.02 PM.png
text: * Central Nervous System (brain and spinal cord; decision-maker) * Peripheral nervous system (everything else; responsible for gathering information and transmitting CNS decisions to other body parts) * The somatic nervous system is the branch of the peripheral nervous system that governs sensory and voluntary motor action * The autonomic nervous system is the branch of the peripheral nervous system that primarily governs involuntary organ functioning and actions * Parasympathetic Nervous System = the branch of the nervous system most active during times of normal functioning * Sympathetic Nervous System = the branch of the autonomic nervous system most active during times of danger or stress
